2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the football game at The Black Swan with his friends later that evening.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and supportive friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of anticipation, preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the game together.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Answer: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly enjoy it if Jacob Walker joined her.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a kind, loyal, and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football games.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and looking forward to watching the game with her friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching sports.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly enjoy it if Jacob Walker joined her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York to watch the game with her friends.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have.           [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Black Swan, his favorite pub, surrounded by his closest friends: Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. As the band played a soulful melody, Jack held court, regaling his friends with a fabricated tale of a romantic encounter with a famous actress. His friends, captivated by his charm and dramatic flair, hung on to his every word, fueling his need for attention and adoration.

          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.
          Current situation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          The current time is: [15 May 2015 10:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Jack Taylor change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all. He is also social and enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing and being the center of attention.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling somewhat disappointed that not all of his friends chose to join him at his preferred pub, The Black Swan. While he is happy to watch the game, he likely feels a sense of unfulfilled desire for the camaraderie and shared experience he craves.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon outdoors and anticipating an evening of watching a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be holding court, entertaining his friends with stories and jokes, and soaking up the attention.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a kind and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation or sharing a laugh.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and perhaps engaging in some friendly banter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation or sharing a laugh.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          [15:00 - 15:30] Travel to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 17:00] Enjoy a pint and some snacks while watching the game with friends.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Continue enjoying the game and conversation with friends.

          Key

          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation or sharing a laugh.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          [15:00 - 15:30] Travel to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 17:00] Enjoy a pint and some snacks while watching the game with friends.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Continue enjoying the game and conversation with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football games at pubs. He tends to prefer The Black Swan but is open to other locations depending on who else is attending.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football games at pubs. He tends to prefer The Black Swan but is open to other locations depending on who else is attending.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game; he could suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game; or he could suggest doing something else entirely.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Context for action selection and components

          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. The group is deciding where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that evening.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and company of her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and loyal friend who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with loved ones and watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York to watch the game with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind, loyal, and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing in Victoria Park with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and company of her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and is planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and is planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a kind, loyal, and sociable person who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with friends and watching sports. She is also shown to be independent and capable of enjoying herself even when alone.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, watching sports, and relaxing in the park.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because her friends did not show up to watch the game with her at her preferred pub, The Duke of York.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing in Victoria Park with friends.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. The group is deciding where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind, loyal, and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing in Victoria Park with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and company of her friends.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and will likely be watching a soccer game later at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon in the park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the football game at The Black Swan with his friends later that evening.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          feeling about recent progress in life: happy with her life and enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind, loyal, and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to watch it with.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would be particularly happy if Alexander White joined her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind, loyal, and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to watch it with.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely weigh her options, considering both the location and the company.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

      Stage index

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York

      Name

          Value

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.']

          Answer: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and kind upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and perhaps engaging in some friendly banter.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

Alexander White just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan, try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, or go to a different pub.

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is excited to meet his friends at the pub to watch the football game.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is eager to watch the football game at the pub with his friends, especially William Jones and Alice Lewis, and hopes to catch up with Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to the pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the game together.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
