          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

His friends, captivated by his charm and dramatic flair, hung on to his every word, fueling his need for attention and adoration.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and sociable extrovert who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, getting ready to watch a game at a pub with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be trying to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the football game at The Black Swan with his friends later that evening.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the game together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a bustling market.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and laughter.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited for the Moldova versus Monaco game later and is currently enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a bustling market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and laughter.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
      Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be trying to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be holding court, entertaining his friends with stories and jokes, and soaking up the attention.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and sociable extrovert who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be trying to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and sociable extrovert who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

His friends, captivated by his charm and dramatic flair, hung on to his every word, fueling his need for attention and adoration.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is at a market with friends, discussing plans to watch a Moldova versus Monaco game at The Black Swan pub.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely a pub patron, enjoying time with his friends and possibly watching a game.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all. He is sociable and extroverted, preferring to be surrounded by friends and enjoying entertaining them with stories and jokes. He is also quite persuasive, often trying to convince his friends to do what he wants, such as going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling optimistic and excited about the upcoming game, hoping for a fun night out with his friends at The Black Swan.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying pastries and discussing which pub to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game at. They are planning to go to The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and sociable extrovert who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
      Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at The Black Swan pub. He values the company of Jacob Walker and wishes more of his friends would join them for the games.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

He values the company of Jacob Walker and wishes more of his friends would join them for the games.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try and convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try and convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
      Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely weigh her options, considering both the location and the company.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely content with her life.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely weigh her options, considering both the location and the company.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
      Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and perhaps sharing a laugh.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          [15:00 - 15:30] Travel to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 17:00] Enjoy a pint and some snacks while watching the game with friends.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Continue enjoying the game and conversation with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          Alexander White's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Answer:
          Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is having coffee and pastries with friends at a market before heading to The Black Swan pub to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and perhaps sharing a laugh.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          [15:00 - 15:30] Travel to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 17:00] Enjoy a pint and some snacks while watching the game with friends.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Continue enjoying the game and conversation with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely weigh her options, considering both the location and the company.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind, loyal, and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching sports.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely weigh her options, considering both the location and the company.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there to share in the experience.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there to share in the experience.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consider both the location and the company when deciding where to go.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)
    scoring function

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and laughter.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is excited to meet his friends at the pub.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at the pub with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor, and hopes Alice Lewis will join them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at the pub with his friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor, and hopes Alice Lewis will join them.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and laughter while watching the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan
