2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and perhaps sharing a laugh.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          current daily occupation: likely at a pub watching a football game with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and fulfilled.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is deciding whether to watch the game at a pub and is considering inviting friends, but is happy to watch alone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and kind upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys watching football with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          [15:00 - 15:30] Travel to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 17:00] Enjoy a pint and some snacks while watching the game with friends.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Continue enjoying the game and conversation with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

His friends, captivated by his charm and dramatic flair, hung on to his every word, fueling his need for attention and adoration.

        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at the pub, hoping to see William Jones. He is neutral about seeing Alice Lewis and Alexander White.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York.           [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

          Value

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he orchestrated the perfect prank on his history teacher, Mr. Henderson. Jack, with his usual charisma, convinced several classmates to help him swap Mr. Henderson's prized collection of antique maps with meticulously crafted replicas. The ensuing chaos and Mr. Henderson's bewildered expression brought Jack immense satisfaction, proving his ability to manipulate and control even the most serious situations.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Black Swan, his favorite pub, surrounded by his closest friends: Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. As the band played a soulful melody, Jack held court, regaling his friends with a fabricated tale of a romantic encounter with a famous actress. His friends, captivated by his charm and dramatic flair, hung on to his every word, fueling his need for attention and adoration.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor would likely be holding court, entertaining his friends with stories and jokes, and soaking up the attention.

          Relevant memories:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Black Swan, his favorite pub, surrounded by his closest friends: Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. As the band played a soulful melody, Jack held court, regaling his friends with a fabricated tale of a romantic encounter with a famous actress. His friends, captivated by his charm and dramatic flair, hung on to his every word, fueling his need for attention and adoration.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he orchestrated the perfect prank on his history teacher, Mr. Henderson. Jack, with his usual charisma, convinced several classmates to help him swap Mr. Henderson's prized collection of antique maps with meticulously crafted replicas. The ensuing chaos and Mr. Henderson's bewildered expression brought Jack immense satisfaction, proving his ability to manipulate and control even the most serious situations.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be holding court, entertaining his friends with stories and jokes, and soaking up the attention.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the football game at The Black Swan with his friends later that evening.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. They hid in a back room, mesmerized by the lingering scent of spilled beer and the faint echo of music. The thrill of transgression mixed with the music's melancholy created a strange cocktail of emotions in Jacob, a feeling of belonging and rebellion he'd never experienced before.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he witnessed Alice Lewis, his closest friend, get into a heated argument with her father about her dreams of becoming a musician. He saw the pain in her eyes, the frustration of being misunderstood, and it mirrored his own internal struggle. He felt a kinship with her, a shared sense of being trapped by expectations and societal norms. He vowed to support her dreams, even if it meant going against the grain.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and supportive friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the football game at The Black Swan with his friends later that evening.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and supportive friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and will likely join them later for a pint at a pub to watch the Andorra-Portugal game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the football game at The Black Swan with his friends later that evening.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stumbled into The Black Swan for the first time with his friends. The music was loud, the air thick with cigarette smoke and the scent of spilled beer, and William felt a thrill course through him; this was where he belonged. He puffed out his chest, trying to appear older and more confident than he felt, and ordered a pint, even though he hated the taste.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he stood backstage at The Black Swan, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob perform with their band. He longed to be up there with them, sharing the spotlight, but fear held him back. He knew he wasn't good enough, not like them, and so he settled for cheering them on from the sidelines, his smile a mask for the envy gnawing at his insides.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

          Final chain of thought

He puffed out his chest, trying to appear older and more confident than he felt, and ordered a pint, even though he hated the taste.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stumbled into The Black Swan for the first time with his friends. The music was loud, the air thick with cigarette smoke and the scent of spilled beer, and William felt a thrill course through him; this was where he belonged. He puffed out his chest, trying to appear older and more confident than he felt, and ordered a pint, even though he hated the taste.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he stood backstage at The Black Swan, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob perform with their band. He longed to be up there with them, sharing the spotlight, but fear held him back. He knew he wasn't good enough, not like them, and so he settled for cheering them on from the sidelines, his smile a mask for the envy gnawing at his insides.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he saw a new kid being bullied in the school hallway. The boy was smaller than the others, and his clothes were clearly hand-me-downs. Alexander stepped in, not with aggression, but with calm words and a reassuring presence. He invited the boy to sit with him and his friends at lunch, and from that day forward, they became inseparable.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.

          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she found a stray kitten huddled beneath the park bench where she often sat to read. She coaxed it out with a piece of her sandwich and hid it in her room, naming it Poe after her favorite author. For weeks, she kept Poe a secret, sneaking him food and cleaning his litter box while her parents were at work, terrified they would make her give him away.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind and loyal friend who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with loved ones and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and company of her friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind and loyal friend who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with loved ones and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and company of her friends.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be holding court, entertaining his friends with stories and jokes, and soaking up the attention.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be trying to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon outdoors and anticipating an evening of watching a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be holding court, entertaining his friends with stories and jokes, and soaking up the attention.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.

        • Jack Taylor's

          Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Black Swan, his favorite pub, surrounded by his closest friends: Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. As the band played a soulful melody, Jack held court, regaling his friends with a fabricated tale of a romantic encounter with a famous actress. His friends, captivated by his charm and dramatic flair, hung on to his every word, fueling his need for attention and adoration.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all. He is also social and enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing and being the center of attention.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling somewhat disappointed that not all of his friends chose to join him at his preferred pub, The Black Swan. While he is happy to watch the game, he likely feels a sense of unfulfilled desire for the camaraderie and shared experience he craves.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be trying to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all. He is also social and enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing and being the center of attention.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling somewhat disappointed that not all of his friends chose to join him at his preferred pub, The Black Swan. While he is happy to watch the game, he likely feels a sense of unfulfilled desire for the camaraderie and shared experience he craves.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon outdoors and anticipating an evening of watching a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be holding court, entertaining his friends with stories and jokes, and soaking up the attention.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have.           Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation or sharing a laugh.

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?

        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
