          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. The group is deciding where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Duke of York to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind, loyal, and sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing in Victoria Park with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and company of her friends.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon in the park.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the football game at The Black Swan with his friends later that evening.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and will likely be watching a soccer game later at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon in the park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the football game at The Black Swan with his friends later that evening.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the game together.

Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a bustling market.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and laughter.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and loyal person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited for the Moldova versus Monaco game later and is currently enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a bustling market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and laughter.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
      Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying pastries and discussing which pub to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game at. They are planning to go to The Black Swan.

      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?

          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be trying to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and sociable extrovert who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.

          Queries

          State

          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all. He is sociable and extroverted, preferring to be surrounded by friends and enjoying entertaining them with stories and jokes. He is also quite persuasive, often trying to convince his friends to do what he wants, such as going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling optimistic and excited about the upcoming game, hoping for a fun night out with his friends at The Black Swan.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a pub patron, enjoying time with his friends and possibly watching a game.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all. He is sociable and extroverted, preferring to be surrounded by friends and enjoying entertaining them with stories and jokes. He is also quite persuasive, often trying to convince his friends to do what he wants, such as going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling optimistic and excited about the upcoming game, hoping for a fun night out with his friends at The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and sociable extrovert who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Engage in lively conversation with friends, regaling them with amusing anecdotes and witty observations.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest a leisurely stroll through the park, using the opportunity to further entertain his friends with stories and jokes.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Persuade the group to head to a nearby pub for lunch, ideally The Black Swan if possible.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Continue to hold court at the pub, ensuring he remains the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Suggest watching the football game at the pub, emphasizing the camaraderie and excitement of the experience.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
      Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at The Black Swan pub.           Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try and convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
      Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely weigh her options, considering both the location and the company.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely weigh her options, considering both the location and the company.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely weigh her options, considering both the location and the company.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Duke of York, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Have dinner at The Duke of York, continuing the conversation and enjoyment with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy The Duke of York for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "How about we head over to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads. Only pub with decent beer and a screen big enough to see the agony on the Israeli goalkeeper's face when Luxembourg scores. Unless you lot want to watch it on a postage stamp.
      Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got the best atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and perhaps sharing a laugh.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a stroll through the park? Could use a bit of a stretch after all this lounging around.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation or sharing a laugh.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and perhaps engaging in some friendly banter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and kind upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys watching football with his friends.

          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and perhaps sharing a laugh.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          [15:00 - 15:30] Travel to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 17:00] Enjoy a pint and some snacks while watching the game with friends.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Continue enjoying the game and conversation with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and perhaps engaging in some friendly banter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and kind upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys watching football with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This pastry's drier than the Sahara, but at least it's not as bland as the game's gonna be tonight. Moldova versus Monaco? Talk about a snoozefest. We're going to The Black Swan, right? Nowhere else will do.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, guys. Trust me, it's got the best atmosphere.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, engaging in conversation and perhaps sharing a laugh.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          [15:00 - 15:30] Travel to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 17:00] Enjoy a pint and some snacks while watching the game with friends.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Continue enjoying the game and conversation with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, and they make a mean burger.

    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stumbled into The Black Swan for the first time with his friends. The music was loud, the air thick with cigarette smoke and the scent of spilled beer, and William felt a thrill course through him; this was where he belonged. He puffed out his chest, trying to appear older and more confident than he felt, and ordered a pint, even though he hated the taste.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he stood backstage at The Black Swan, watching his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob perform with their band. He longed to be up there with them, sharing the spotlight, but fear held him back. He knew he wasn't good enough, not like them, and so he settled for cheering them on from the sidelines, his smile a mask for the envy gnawing at his insides.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later that evening. He particularly enjoys the company of Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can head to The Black Swan pub to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head to The Black Swan pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones can head to The Black Swan pub to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head to The Black Swan pub.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York

          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes William Jones will be there. He would also enjoy Jack Taylor's company but isn't particularly bothered about seeing Alice Lewis or Jacob Walker.

Alexander White just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          current daily occupation: likely enjoying a pint with his friends at a pub, watching the European football cup.
          feeling about recent progress in life: generally content with his life, enjoying simple pleasures like spending time with friends and watching football.

          Answer: Alexander White is a kind, sociable, and upper-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [17:00 - 18:00] Continue enjoying the game and conversation with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Duke of York

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he found himself at The Black Swan, his favorite pub, surrounded by his closest friends: Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob. As the band played a soulful melody, Jack held court, regaling his friends with a fabricated tale of a romantic encounter with a famous actress. His friends, captivated by his charm and dramatic flair, hung on to his every word, fueling his need for attention and adoration.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who enjoys being the center of attention. He is also a social person who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling optimistic and excited about the upcoming game.

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a charismatic and manipulative individual who thrives on attention and enjoys being the center of it all.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone else fancy a pint later? I hear The Black Swan is showing the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan's the only place to watch the game, lads. Anywhere else is sacrilege.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me. Let's head over there soon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is showing the game too, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York has a great atmosphere for watching games, you know.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be holding court, entertaining his friends with stories and jokes, and soaking up the attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling optimistic and excited about the upcoming game.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a charismatic and social individual who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
